00:00:10:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:10:040000.Dialogue: Clarify something for me. Isn't the point of a communal meal the exchange of ideas and opinions? An opportunity to consider important issues of the day?

00:00:20:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:20:150000.Dialogue: It is. You just kind of put a damper on things when you said, "The next person I see talking with food in their mouth will be put to death."

00:00:28:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:28:010000.Dialogue: Well, we could argue about who said what all night long, but to set things back on course, I will propose a new topic of conversation.

00:00:38:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:38:120000.Dialogue: What is the best number? By the way, there's only one correct answer.

00:00:59:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:59:070000.Dialogue: 73 is the 21st prime number. Its mirror, 37, is the 12th, and its mirror, 21, is the product of multiplying-- hang on to your hats-- seven and three.

00:01:14:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:14:190000.Dialogue: We get it. 73 is the Chuck Norris of numbers.

00:01:18:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:18:160000.Dialogue: Chuck Norris wishes. In binary, 73 is a palindrome: one-zero-zero- one-zero-zero-one which backwards is "one-zero- zero-one-zero-zero-one"-- exactly the same. All Chuck Norris backwards gets you is: "Sirron Kcuhc."

00:01:36:010000.Speaker: Raj
00:01:36:010000.Dialogue: Just for the record, when you enter 5,318,008 on a calculator, upside-down it spells "boobies""

00:01:47:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:47:140000.Dialogue: Remember when you were wondering why the girls didn't want to eat with us tonight?

00:01:54:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:54:050000.Dialogue: I love your little heart locket, Bernadette.

00:01:56:170000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:01:56:170000.Dialogue: Oh, thanks. Howard gave it to me. It's the cutest thing. Every time I have dinner with his mom, the next day I get jewelry.

00:02:05:140000.Speaker: Amy
00:02:05:140000.Dialogue: Did you know that the iconic Valentine's heart shape is not actually based on the shape of a human heart, but rather on the shape of the buttocks of a female bending over?

00:02:15:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:15:060000.Dialogue: Oh, so I spent seventh grade dotting my I's with little asses?

00:02:25:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:25:200000.Dialogue: Hey, Zack, what are you doing here?

00:02:27:170000.Speaker: Zack
00:02:27:170000.Dialogue: My dad's company prints the menus for this place. I'm just dropping off some new ones laminated. Makes 'em easier to clean if people throw up on 'em.

00:02:35:060000.Speaker: Zack
00:02:35:060000.Dialogue: Guess how I got the idea?

00:02:36:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:36:140000.Dialogue: Yeah, I got it, I got it. Uh, Zack, these are my friends Bernadette and Amy.

00:02:46:110000.Speaker: Zack
00:02:46:110000.Dialogue: Okay, well, it was good to see you.

00:02:51:020000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:02:51:020000.Dialogue: He's really cute. How do you know him?

00:02:52:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:52:220000.Dialogue: Oh, we went out a couple of times.

00:02:54:130000.Speaker: Amy
00:02:54:130000.Dialogue: I'm often flummoxed by current slang. Does "went out" mean "had intercourse"?

00:03:04:010000.Speaker: Amy
00:03:04:010000.Dialogue: Interesting. And was it not satisfactory?

00:03:06:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:06:210000.Dialogue: No, it was great. He just didn't really challenge me on an intellectual level.

00:03:11:060000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:03:11:060000.Dialogue: Couldn't you just fool around with him and then listen to NPR?

00:03:14:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:14:220000.Dialogue: Wouldn't help. Zack can't even spell NPR.

00:03:19:100000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:03:19:100000.Dialogue: It's what I do with Howard. I'm much smarter than he is. But it's important to protect his manhood.

00:03:32:050000.Speaker: Amy
00:03:32:050000.Dialogue: I'm suddenly feeling flushed. My heart rate is elevated, my palms are clammy, my mouth is dry. In addition, I keep involuntarily saying "hoo."

00:03:41:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:41:200000.Dialogue: Oh, we know what's causing that, don't we?

00:03:45:130000.Speaker: Amy
00:03:45:130000.Dialogue: It's no mystery. I obviously have the flu coupled with sudden-onset Tourette's syndrome.

00:04:17:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:17:090000.Dialogue: Did you hear about the accident at the bio lab?

00:04:20:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:20:130000.Dialogue: They were injecting rats with radioactive isotopes and one of the techs got bit.

00:04:29:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:29:080000.Dialogue: No, he got five stitches and a tetanus shot.

00:04:37:170000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:37:170000.Dialogue: Well, you get bit by a radioactive animal in a lab, you kind of want to turn into a superhero.

00:04:42:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:42:100000.Dialogue: Yeah, but who'd want to become Rat-Man?

00:04:45:150000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:45:150000.Dialogue: Who wouldn't? You could zip through a maze in nothing flat, squeeze through really small holes, and shut down restaurants in a single bound. And the best part is, if I were Rat-Man, you could be my sidekick, Mouse Boy.

00:05:07:090000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:07:090000.Dialogue: You don't like "Mouse Boy"? How about "Kid Vermin"?

00:05:10:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:10:220000.Dialogue: First of all, if we had superpowers, I wouldn't be the sidekick. You'd be the sidekick.

00:05:18:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:18:090000.Dialogue: Leonard, settle this. Of the two of us, who's the obvious sidekick?

00:05:26:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:26:190000.Dialogue: 12 years after high school, and I'm still at the nerd table.

00:05:32:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:32:160000.Dialogue: Aren't you slicing that man's brain a little too thin?

00:05:42:070000.Speaker: Amy
00:05:42:070000.Dialogue: It's too thin if I were making a foot-long brain sandwich at Quiznos. For examination under a two- photon microscope, it's fine.

00:05:55:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:55:010000.Dialogue: Well, you're the expert. If the correct way to do it is the wrong way, then I yield.

00:06:00:180000.Speaker: Amy
00:06:00:180000.Dialogue: Very well. If you die and donate your body to science, I promise to slice your brain like Canadian bacon.

00:06:08:060000.Speaker: Amy
00:06:08:060000.Dialogue: Now, if you'll excuse me, I have to take my temperature.

00:06:12:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:12:160000.Dialogue: Are you monitoring your circadian rhythms in order to identify your periods of maximum mental acuity? I did that one summer. Ah, youth.

00:06:22:000000.Speaker: Amy
00:06:22:000000.Dialogue: No, I experienced some distressing symptoms last night, so I'm checking my vital signs every hour.

00:06:27:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:27:190000.Dialogue: I'd be happy to create a chart and participate in a differential diagnosis.

00:06:36:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:36:030000.Dialogue: All right. What were the symptoms?

00:06:40:170000.Speaker: Amy
00:06:40:170000.Dialogue: Elevated heart rate, moist palms, dry mouth and localized vascular throbbing.

00:06:55:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:55:220000.Dialogue: Interesting. Not body parts that usually team up.

00:07:03:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:03:160000.Dialogue: What about environmental factors? Describe the scene for me.

00:07:07:130000.Speaker: Amy
00:07:07:130000.Dialogue: I was sitting in a restaurant with Penny and Bernadette, drinking water-- carbonated as it was a special occasion. Penny's friend Zack stopped by and said hello and I said "hoo."

00:07:26:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:26:230000.Dialogue: All right, let's start over. What did you say when Zack walked in?

00:07:38:060000.Speaker: Amy
00:07:38:060000.Dialogue: I'm not saying "hoo" now. I said "hoo" last night.

00:07:40:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:40:220000.Dialogue: And the answer was Zack, correct?

00:07:43:060000.Speaker: Amy
00:07:43:060000.Dialogue: There was no question. I simply said "hoo."

00:07:49:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:49:010000.Dialogue: All right, I think I have enough to go on. Possible explanations for your symptoms are, in descending order of likelihood: hyperthyroidism, premature menopause, hosting an alien parasite or-- and I only include it for the sake of covering absolutely all bases-- sexual arousal.

00:08:12:010000.Speaker: Amy
00:08:12:010000.Dialogue: Where would I have picked up an alien parasite?

00:08:19:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:19:180000.Dialogue: Let me ask you a question. What are you most afraid of?

00:08:22:160000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:22:160000.Dialogue: I don't know. Um... Nuclear war. Accidentally being buried alive. Any of those movies where you get that phone call that says you're going to die. And then you do.

00:08:32:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:32:090000.Dialogue: No. Something very specific that we both know you, Rajesh Koothrappali, are terrified of.

00:08:38:060000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:38:060000.Dialogue: Well, type two diabetes runs in my family. The thought of losing a toe...

00:08:46:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:46:180000.Dialogue: A jar with a big spider in it, of course. Bravery test. First one to take his hand out is the sidekick.

00:09:02:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:02:040000.Dialogue: No. But it's a stupid test.

00:09:04:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:04:100000.Dialogue: Oh, really? What if the earth was in danger and the only way to save it was to stick your hand in a jar with a spider?

00:09:11:100000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:11:100000.Dialogue: Oh, yeah? What if the earth was in danger and the only way to save it was to take a shower in the locker room and let other guys see you naked?

00:09:19:010000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:19:010000.Dialogue: Oh, come on. That's never gonna happen. Put your hand in the jar or forever be revealed as my sidekick.

00:09:31:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:31:070000.Dialogue: How did you get so brave all of a sudden?

00:09:33:160000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:33:160000.Dialogue: It's easy. The spider's crawling up your arm.

00:09:42:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:42:090000.Dialogue: Get it off! Get it off! Please, Raj! Please. Oh!

00:09:54:070000.Speaker: Amy
00:09:54:070000.Dialogue: My blood work shows thyroid function normal. Cortisol levels normal.

00:09:58:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:58:080000.Dialogue: How about your follicle-stimulating hormone levels?

00:10:02:020000.Speaker: Amy
00:10:02:020000.Dialogue: Sheldon, I am not going through menopause.

00:10:04:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:04:200000.Dialogue: Are you sure? You said that with the testy bark of an old biddy.

00:10:10:090000.Speaker: Amy
00:10:10:090000.Dialogue: I think we need to face the cold, hard truth: I was sexually aroused by Penny's friend Zack.

00:10:17:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:17:100000.Dialogue: Hang on. I don't know that we've given the alien parasite hypothesis a fair shake.

00:10:23:100000.Speaker: Amy
00:10:23:100000.Dialogue: Let's look at this logically. I have a stomach; I get hungry. I have genitals; I have the potential for sexual arousal.

00:10:29:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:29:120000.Dialogue: A cross we all must bear.

00:10:34:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:34:160000.Dialogue: You know, in difficult moments like this, I often turn to a force greater than myself.

00:10:43:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:43:190000.Dialogue: Did you see Star Trek: The Motion Picture?

00:11:00:100000.Speaker: Amy
00:11:00:100000.Dialogue: Are you suggesting we live our lives guided by the philosophies found in cheap science fiction?

00:11:13:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:13:130000.Dialogue: Using Kolinar to suppress my anger at that last comment.

00:11:19:230000.Speaker: Amy
00:11:19:230000.Dialogue: Is it possible that your concern for me at this moment is motivated by nothing more than simple jealousy?

00:11:26:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:26:140000.Dialogue: I hadn't considered that. Give me a moment.

00:11:37:050000.Speaker: Amy
00:11:37:050000.Dialogue: You reject it because you don't feel jealousy, or because you are suppressing jealousy?

00:11:43:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:43:180000.Dialogue: I think I'll eat my lunch at home.

00:11:48:040000.Speaker: Amy
00:11:48:040000.Dialogue: That's not your lunch, Sheldon; those are the cadaver brain specimens.

00:11:53:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:53:020000.Dialogue: Oh. As they were incorrectly sliced, you can see how I could mistake them for my sashimi.

00:12:07:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:07:120000.Dialogue: Hey. Isn't tomorrow your usual laundry night?

00:12:10:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:10:180000.Dialogue: The supermarket was out of my regular fabric softener. If this one under- or over-softens, I'll need time to make things right.

00:12:21:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:21:040000.Dialogue: The alternative would be to think backwards. That's just remembering.

00:12:29:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:29:030000.Dialogue: Amy's changed. I might have to let her go.

00:12:35:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:35:130000.Dialogue: I thought she was a highly evolved creature of pure intellect, like me. But recent events indicate that she may be a slave to her baser urges. Like you.

00:12:47:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:47:220000.Dialogue: Just going to skip over that insult.

00:12:53:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:53:010000.Dialogue: Yeah. That's why I'm going to skip over it. Are you saying that Amy is... oh, what's the scientific word...

00:13:07:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:07:180000.Dialogue: It's simple biology. There's nothing I can do about it.

00:13:19:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:19:230000.Dialogue: I'm suggesting there might be something you could do about... Amy's urges?

00:13:30:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:30:150000.Dialogue: It's illegal to spay a human being.

00:13:36:080000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:36:080000.Dialogue: Yeah. That's not what I had in mind.

00:13:38:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:38:130000.Dialogue: Oh. Oh! You mean... something I could do.

00:13:46:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:46:090000.Dialogue: Well, I was hoping to avoid this. But I might as well get it over with. Thank you, Penny. I'll let you know what happens.

00:14:01:140000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:14:01:140000.Speaker: Penny

00:14:06:100000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:14:06:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:06:100000.Dialogue: Yes. This is Dr. Sheldon Cooper. Is this the Zack Johnson who used to have coitus with my neighbor Penny?

00:14:16:010000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:14:16:010000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:14:24:000000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:14:24:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:24:000000.Dialogue: Hello. I'm looking for a Zack Johnson who used to have coitus with my neighbor Penny. Coitus. It means intercourse. And I have a feeling I'm speaking to the right Zack. This is Sheldon Cooper. Fine. Shelly. Yes, that does sound like a girl's name. No, it doesn't bother me. Yes, "Smelly Shelly" does bother me. Let me tell you why I'm calling. I'd like to know if you'd be interested in having sex with Amy Farrah Fowler. Amy Farrah Fowler. Yes, that is  a girl's name. Good grief. It's like trying to talk to a dolphin.

00:15:05:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:05:220000.Dialogue: Really? This is going to decide who's the hero and who's the sidekick?

00:15:21:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:21:090000.Dialogue: Every idea is better than this idea.

00:15:29:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:29:200000.Dialogue: I don't think this kind of wrestling has a bell.

00:15:31:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:31:100000.Dialogue: Fine. How do you want to start?

00:15:33:070000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:33:070000.Dialogue: I say, uh, how about one, two, three, go?

00:15:38:010000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:38:010000.Dialogue: Okay, how about, uh... On your mark, get set, go?

00:15:41:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:41:120000.Dialogue: That's for a footrace. If you want to race, we have to go outside.

00:15:44:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:44:040000.Dialogue: No, it's chilly outside. Didn't bring my jacket.

00:15:48:110000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:48:110000.Dialogue: Oh, for crying out loud. What kind of superhero needs a jacket?

00:15:52:010000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:52:010000.Dialogue: What kind of superhero says, "Dibs on the red tights! Dibs on the red tights!"

00:15:56:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:56:030000.Dialogue: All right, how about this? Ready, wrestle.

00:15:59:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:59:020000.Dialogue: Wait. Are we starting now? Or is that what you're going to say when we do start, or...

00:16:12:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:12:100000.Dialogue: Suppose there are worse ways to spend a Friday night.

00:16:23:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:23:060000.Dialogue: Look at this stamp. On what authority are they permitted to mutilate patrons as they enter?

00:16:32:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:32:180000.Dialogue: Little comfort tonight. I look like a Hell's Angel.

00:16:39:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:39:220000.Dialogue: Are you sure this is what you want to do?

00:16:42:140000.Speaker: Amy
00:16:42:140000.Dialogue: It's not what I want to do; it's what I have to do.

00:16:47:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:47:080000.Dialogue: Go, Amy Farrah Fowler. Follow your endocrine system.

00:16:53:160000.Speaker: Amy
00:16:53:160000.Dialogue: Thank you, Sheldon. You're a good friend.

00:17:01:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:01:050000.Dialogue: This is never going to come off.

00:17:04:060000.Speaker: Amy
00:17:04:060000.Dialogue: Excuse me? Zack, I am Amy Farrah Fowler. We met the other night. I have spent my life in pursuit of pure knowledge. Until I met you, my decisions were founded in logic and reason. And yet here I stand before you, 130 pounds of raging estrogen, longing to grab hold of your gluteus maximus and make Shakespeare's metaphorical beast with two backs.

00:17:30:110000.Speaker: Amy
00:17:30:110000.Dialogue: On the other hand, as I look at the blank, ape-like expression on your face, I have decided to adopt the Vulcan practice of Kolinar.

00:17:47:150000.Speaker: Amy
00:17:47:150000.Dialogue: That should hold me for a while.

00:18:00:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:00:040000.Dialogue: I'm legally obligated to inform you that I took a karate lesson when I was 11. I'd be a regular ninja by now if my mom could've arranged a carpool.

00:18:10:150000.Speaker: Raj
00:18:10:150000.Dialogue: Oh, yeah? Well, I've been taking Pilates class at the rec center,

00:18:14:070000.Speaker: Ra
00:18:14:070000.Dialogue: and my abs look like sections of a Hershey bar.

00:18:17:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:17:040000.Dialogue: Oh, yeah? Won't matter, you're going down!

00:18:20:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:20:230000.Dialogue: If anybody's going to go down, it's going to be you.

00:18:23:000000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:23:000000.Dialogue: Fellas. It's been 30 minutes. Nobody's touched each other.

00:18:28:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:28:230000.Dialogue: I'm glad you decided to reject your animal hindbrain and return to the realm of pure intellect.

00:18:41:130000.Speaker: Amy
00:18:41:130000.Dialogue: An experiment. Nope. Nothing. Never mind.

00:18:58:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:58:130000.Dialogue: I prefer to think that I can't lose.

00:19:04:170000.Speaker: Raj
00:19:04:170000.Dialogue: You're wrong. It's only a matter of time before you fall into Rat-Man's rat trap.

00:19:10:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:10:230000.Dialogue: You pathetic fool! If there were a rat-catcher, wouldn't it catch Rat-Man?

00:19:15:090000.Speaker: Raj
00:19:15:090000.Dialogue: Just because I didn't express myself well doesn't mean my underlying point was invalid! You bloviating buffoon!

00:19:24:110000.Speaker: Raj
00:19:24:110000.Dialogue: You crimson coward! Oh, Leonard, wake up, you're missing some very excellent superhero quips.
